title: Communities – All channels should have a category

milestone.title: 1.27.0 - Alpha
milestone.description:
### This release *might* be the release that becomes Status Mobile's first public alpha

Mobile dev team priorities In priority order:

**1. Finish anything that wasn't completed in the previous 1.26 cycle**

**2. Fix bugs, both functional and UX fit-and-finish defects.**  

- specifically focus on bugs related to the Communities functionality, when a community is utilizing all the community admin functionality available in Status Desktop

- any remaining UX quality defects

**3. Complete building any Communities functionality that's in the MVP Communities designs and not yet built**  

**4. Work on any outstanding ad-hoc group chat functionality as per the MVP spec**  

- Test with Status Desktop to ensure mobile and desktop interop in all aspects of ad-hoc group chat functionality.


**--- Things that should NOT be worked on this cycle ---**

- We shouldn't start anything in Settings or Profile related, with the exception of Wallet setting that the Mobile Wallet team may work on.

body:
# Feature Issue

[Figma Design](https://www.figma.com/file/h9wo4GipgZURbqqr1vShFN/Communities-for-Mobile?type=design&node-id=7898-522759&mode=design&t=K8JlC5NndcDKJBdv-0)

### User Story

Using the Desktop App, create a Channel and add a Category:

![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/5999878/24c057ea-6b1a-4adb-8662-bdd5e0e64747)

The category design should be consistently reflected in the mobile interface as follows:

![image](https://github.com/status-im/status-mobile/assets/5999878/210123e1-8fde-4df4-a983-b0fe2502efb2)

### Description
The primary goal of this issue is to integrate the 'Channels' category, currently present in our desktop application, into our mobile app, ensuring that the design, especially the dividers based on these categories, is consistently reflected across both platforms.

### Acceptance Criteria

– Follow Figma Design
– Implement the necessary adjustments or developments in the mobile app
– Improved user navigation and aesthetic appeal in the mobile app, mirroring the desktop app's established design.

### Notes

– Please, be aware that in Mobile Figma this feature is treated as "Divider label"/"Parent component"
– Attention should be paid to the responsiveness of the design elements, particularly the dividers, to ensure they adapt well to different mobile screen sizes.
